result.execSummary:
The defendant Marceles L Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $489.28 to be paid first and foremost to Becca P. Cash bail on deposit in this case and 14CM1549 to apply.

Pay all applicable court costs (after restitution) during period of probation. Cash bail on deposit in this case and 14CM1549 to apply. If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment or attend school.

No firearms or dangerous weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
No contact with the victim unless approved by the Court.

Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program. 
Absolute sobriety--no illegal drug or alcohol.
Random screens.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until next court date of 3-20-15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marceles L Griffin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  Court ordered defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with 3 days credit for time served.
.
COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED until next court date.
-Successfully complete a Batterers Intervention Program.
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No contact with the victim unless approved by the Court.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.  
-No firearms or dangerous weapons.
-Restitution set at $489.28 to be paid first and foremost to Becca P.  Cash bail on deposit in this case and 14CM1549 to apply.
-Pay all applicable court costs (after restitution) during period of probation.  Cash bail on deposit in this case and 14CM1549 to apply.  If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the defense request for adjournment.  Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Impact Statement Received and Filed.

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Scott A Wales.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court ordered bail from case 14CF1549 to be transfered to this case. Court VACATED Jury Trial date of 8/4/2014. Case adjourned to branch 40 for Sentencing.

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Scott A Wales.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Scheduling Conference held.  Court will address state's motion for joinder at the final pretrial conference.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Defendant taken into custody by Milwaukee Police on another matter.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court amends no contact order by removing the 5200 block of North 62nd Street.  No contact with Becca P and Yolanda B remains.

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Scott A Wales.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court reserved ruling on State's motin for joinder.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

04-25-14

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Becca P; Yolanda B or the 5200 Block of N 62nd Street

Defendant Marceles L Griffin in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant Marceles L Griffin in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   ADA approved quick date.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
